posts._title: Werner Herzog – Auch Zwerge haben klein angefangen AKA Even Dwarfs Started Small (1970)
posts.title: Auch Zwerge haben klein angefangen
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: The inhabitants of an institution in a remote country rebel against their keepers. Their acts of rebellion are by turns humorous, boring and alarming. An allegory on the problematic nature of fully liberating the human spirit, as both commendable and disturbing elements of our nature come forward. The film shows how justifiable revolt may …

posts.title: Hasret: Sehnsucht
posts.excerpt: A European director is commissioned to make a documentary about Istanbul. He starts to film its everyday life – but soon becomes drawn to the darker, more mysterious side of the city – its past, its secrets, its ghosts. Gradually he succumbs to obsession.

posts._title: Tom Tykwer – Lola rennt AKA Run Lola Run (1999)
posts.title: Lola rennt
posts.excerpt: Pieces of the Action A low-budget no-brainer, Run Lola Run is a lot more fun than Speed, a big-budget no-brainer from five years ago. It’s just as fast moving, the music is better, and though the characters are almost as hackneyed and predictable, the conceptual side has a lot more punch. If Run Lola Run …

posts.title: Fist Fight
posts.excerpt: Breer’s extraordinary autobiographical film combines personal and family photos with intense colors, textures and geometric abstractions. Originally presented as part of Karlheinz Sotckhausen’s 1964 premiere of Originale. – Harvard Film Archive

posts.title: The 60’s
posts.excerpt: The Herlihys are a working class family from Chicago whose three children take wildly divergent paths: Brian joins the Marines right out of High School and goes to Vietnam, Michael becomes involved in the civil rights movement and after campaigning for Bobby Kennedy and Eugene McCarthy becomes involved in radical politics, and Katie gets pregnant, …

posts._title: Yesim Ustaoglu – Iz AKA The Track (1994)
posts.title: Iz
posts.excerpt: Kemal is a plainclothes policeman investigating a suicide whose face has been obliterated. He becomes obsessed with the real appearance of the dead man.

posts._title: François Villiers – Le puits aux trois vérités AKA Three Faces of Sin (1961)
posts.title: Le puits aux trois vérités
posts.excerpt: Synopsis Midnight in Paris, Faubourg St Honoré. In one house, a woman suddenly screams and the sound of a gunshot is heard. A short time later, Laurent Lénaud, a young painter, is running away with a suitcase. Arriving at a hotel, he enters a room where a young woman named Rossana is crying. The room …

posts.title: Cameo Kirby
posts.excerpt: The director formerly known as Sean O’Feeney is billed as John Ford for the first time here, and he helps make this one of John Gilbert’s best pre-MGM features. Cameo Kirby (John Gilbert), once a man of high social standing, has become a professional gambler and works the Mississippi riverboats of the 1800’s. An old …

posts._title: Sergei Parajanov – Pervyy paren aka The First Lad (1959)
posts.title: Pervyy paren
posts.excerpt: A gem from Paradjanov’s early oeuvre is a musical agitation film or a romantic comedy, made by the young director under the guidance of Alexander Dovzhenko and set in the immense fields of the collectivised Ukraine. The social realism is replaced by colourful, convivial and dancing shots of the “Pabieda” (Victory) kolkhoz, where peasant women …

posts._title: Alfredo Ureta – La guarida del topo (2011)
posts.title: La guarida del topo
posts.excerpt: Quote: Daniel, loner and hermit, is forced to give overnight shelter to Anna, his neighbor’s niece. The need for affection and human warmth of these two injured people will emerge, turning into a romance. Things get complicated when Anna’s husband appears. Quote: Daniel, el Topo, hombre ermitaño e incomunicado, que goza de toda soledad posible. …
